intro: Ursia gordeievii, commonly known as the Bolivian thyme, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its native habitat. Ursia gordeievii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
